p: Along with student–supervisor discussions, the classroom component of clinical programmes has important roles to play in revealing the social justice and ethical legal practice dimensions of their work. Supervisors can share with students the social justice dimensions of their work.36 One key practice that can support student awareness and understanding of social justice issues is to identify and name the tensions raised by the law’s operation in particular circumstances. Supervisors can draw student attention to how those tensions can be effectively managed.
